io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty.robot

Class HTTPLoginRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty.robot.HTTPLoginRobot

  • public class HTTPLoginRobot
extends Object
    HTTPLoginRobot is a class that is specifially designed to navigate to a login page, fill in credentials and post the form and log the user in. It supports automatic detection of correct username / email and password nodes when setting credentials. All HTML parsing is handled by a given HTMLParser. This class is built on top of HTTPNavigator and is therefore layer 3.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer

    • Field Detail

      • USERNAME_KEYWORDS

        public static String[] USERNAME_KEYWORDS
        Array of keywords that are used during automatic username / email node detection. It takes into account the order of words.

      • PASSWORD_KEYWORDS

        public static String[] PASSWORD_KEYWORDS
        Array of keywords that are used during automatic password node detection. It takes into account the order of words.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPLoginRobot

        public HTTPLoginRobot(HTMLParser htmlParser)
        Creates a new HTTPLoginRobot using given htmlParser.
        Parameters:
        htmlParser - is a parser that will turn a HTML string into a DOM document

    • Method Detail

      • navigateToLoginPage

        public void navigateToLoginPage(URL url)
        Navigates to the login page using HTTPNavigator. That means it will follow redirects. It will parse HTML when there are no more redirects.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL of the login page

      • getFormData

        public Map<String,String> getFormData()
        Gets the current form data in form of a <name, value> map.
        Returns:
        read-only wrapper map of form data

      • updateFormData

        public void updateFormData()
        Updates form data from last parsed HTML.
        Throws:
        HTTPRobotException - if URL provided by 'action' attribute in form is not a valid URL

      • setLoginCredentials

        public void setLoginCredentials(String username,
                                String password)
        Updates form data with login credentials.
        Parameters:
        username - is the username / email used to login
        password - is the password used to login
        Throws:
        HTTPRobotException - if auto-detection of usernameNode or passwordNode fails

      • setLoginCredentials

        public void setLoginCredentials(String usernameNodeName,
                                String passwordNodeName,
                                String username,
                                String password)
        Updates form data with login credentials.
        Parameters:
        usernameNodeName - is the name of the HTML username input node
        passwordNodeName - is the name of the HTML password input node
        username - is the username / email used to login
        password - is the password used to login
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if usernameNodeName or passwordNodeName is null or empty
        NoSuchElementException - if no node matches the usernameNodeName or passwordNodeName

      • sendForm

        public void sendForm()
        Sends the form with the current form data and follows all redirects. It will parse HTML when there are no more redirects.

      • autoDetectNodeName

        public String autoDetectNodeName(String[] keywords)
        Method for auto-detecting a node name given an array of keywords (in order).
        Parameters:
        keywords - is an array of keywords the node name can contain (ignoring case)
        Returns:
        name of node if found, null otherwise

      • autoDetectUsernameNodeName

        public String autoDetectUsernameNodeName()
        Method for auto-detecting username / email node based on USERNAME_KEYWORDS
        Returns:
        name of username node if found, null otherwise
        See Also:
        autoDetectNodeName(String[])

      • autoDetectPasswordNodeName

        public String autoDetectPasswordNodeName()
        Method for auto-detecting password node based on PASSWORD_KEYWORDS
        Returns:
        name of password node if found, null otherwise
        See Also:
        autoDetectNodeName(String[])

      • getNavigator

        public HTTPNavigator getNavigator()
        Gets the underlying HTTPNavigator used (layer 2)
        Returns:
        HTTPNavigator used by login robot
